intro: Lepidium tuzgoeluense, commonly known as the Tuzgölü mustard, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Lepidium tuzgoeluense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
